00:17, 19 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Christian Dannemann Eriksen''' ({{IPA-da|ˈkʁεsdjan ˈdanəman ˈeˀɐ̯iksn̩}}; born 14 February 1992) is a Danish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for {{English football updater|TottenhH}} club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[Denmark national football team|Denmark national team]]. He made his debut for the Denmark national team in March 2010, and was the youngest player of the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa.<ref name=youngest>{{cite web |url=http://sport.stv.tv/fifa-world-cup/180776-world-cup-squads-the-story-of-the-stats/ |title=World Cup squads: The story of the stats | FIFA World Cup 2010 | |publisher=STV Sport |date=2 June 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref><ref name=youngest2>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1611883.html |publisher=UEFA |date=23 May 2011 |first=Berend |last=Scholten |title=Eriksen: I've got a lot to learn |accessdate=22 January 2013}}</ref>
In 2011, Eriksen was named [[Danish Football Player of the Year]], [[Dutch Football Talent of the Year]], [[List of AFC Ajax records#AFC Ajax prize winners|Ajax Talent of the Year]] ([[Marco van Basten]] Award), and made the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship#Team of the Tournament|UEFA Euro U-21 Team of the Tournament]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/sports/2011-11/08/c_131234281.htm |title=Eriksen selected as Danish "Player of the Year" |agency=Xinhua News Agency |date=8 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150114162516/http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/sports/2011-11/08/c_131234281.htm |archivedate=14 January 2015}}</ref> He also won the Eredivisie with Ajax in [[2010–11 Eredivisie|2010–11]], [[2011–12 Eredivisie|2011–12]] and in [[2012–13 Eredivisie|2012–13]] before departing for Tottenham in August 2013 for a reported fee of around £11.5 million.<ref name=spurssigning>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/8898245/tottenham-confirm-the-signing-of-midfielder-christian-eriksen-from-ajax |title=Tottenham confirm the signing of midfielder Christian Eriksen from Ajax |publisher=Sky Sports |date=31 August 2013 |accessdate=19 March 2017 |language=en}}</ref> He won the Tottenham Hotspur Player of the Year award for the 2013–14 season and in 2015 won his third consecutive [[Danish Football Player of the Year]] award.
==Club career== ===Early career in Middelfart and Odense=== Born in [[Middelfart]], Denmark, Eriksen followed in his father Thomas' footsteps when he started playing football in the academy of local side, [[Middelfart G&BK|Middelfart]].<ref name=makings>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jun/15/christian-eriksen-making-of-denmark-tottenham |title=The making of Christian Eriksen: from the start he was a ‘wow’ footballer |publisher=The Guardian |last=Ames |first=Nick |date=15 June 2018 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref> Eriksen's father was also one of the coaches at the time and in 2004 they helped the youth side finish unbeaten in the local youth championship for the third time in a period of four years.<ref name=makings/> The following year, he joined [[Odense Boldklub]] who competed in the Danish youth championships and within a year had helped the club to an age-group title. It was at OB that Eriksen first began showing signs of his technical ability, with his dribbling and free-kick techniques lauded by then-coach, Tonny Hermansen.<ref name=makings/> His form at youth level attracted the attention of a number of major European clubs, including the likes [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite news |title=FC Barcelona kigger på OB-talent |date=4 April 2008 |newspaper=[[B.T. (tabloid)|BT]] |url=http://www.bt.dk/sport/fc-barcelona-kigger-paa-ob-talent |first=Niels |last=Hansen |language=Danish}}</ref> Eriksen ultimately underwent trials with both clubs as well as [[Real Madrid CF|Real Madrid]], [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], but finally decided to move to [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]], stating, "My first step should not be too big. I knew that playing in the Netherlands would be very good for my development. Then Ajax arrived and that was a fantastic option."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.voetbalzone.nl/doc.asp?uid=139277 |title='De eerste stap moest niet te groot zijn, Ajax was fantastische optie' |publisher=Voetbalzone |date=28 February 2011 |accessdate=28 February 2011 |language=Dutch}}</ref>
===Ajax=== ====2008–2010: Youth and first-team squad==== [[File:EriksenAjax3.jpg|thumb|Eriksen represented [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] between 2008 and 2013 during which time he helped the club to four [[Eredivisie]] titles.]]
On 17 October 2008, Eriksen signed a two-and-a-half-year contract with [[Amsterdam]]-based club, [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]].<ref name=uefastarlet>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=762604.html |title=Danish starlet Eriksen opts for Ajax |publisher=UEFA |date=17 October 2008 |accessdate=19 April 2010}}</ref> The [[transfer fee]] received by OB was estimated at €1 million (£847,199) while Middelfart also received a sum of €35 000 which they later used to construct a football pitch.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport.co.uk/news/Football/34596/_Wenger_eager_to_sign_up_Ajax_starlet_after_Bergkamps_endorsemsent_.aspx |title=Wenger eager to sign up Ajax starlet after Bergkamp's endorsemsent |website=Sport.co.uk |first=Nigel |last=Brown |date=23 February 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100226101000/http://www.sport.co.uk/news/Football/34596/_Wenger_eager_to_sign_up_Ajax_starlet_after_Bergkamps_endorsemsent_.aspx |archivedate=26 February 2010}}</ref><ref name=makings/> He worked his way through the youth teams at Ajax and was promoted to the [[first team]] squad in January 2010, where he was given the number 51 shirt.<ref name=uefafaith/> Later that month, he made his first team debut in a 1–1 [[Eredivisie]] with [[NAC Breda]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Eriksen fik debut i Ajax |language=Danish |date=17 January 2010 |accessdate=17 January 2010 |publisher=[[DR (broadcaster)|Danmarks Radio]] |url=http://www.dr.dk/Sporten/Fodbold/2010/01/17/160629.htm}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://talksport.com/uncategorized/100325/christian-eriksen-player-every-club-wants-ten-things-you-need-know/ |title=Christian Eriksen – The player every club wants: Ten things you need to know |publisher=talkSport |last=Mannion |first=Damian |date=10 February 2011 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Ajax on 25 March in a 6–0 win over [[Go Ahead Eagles]] in the [[KNVB Cup|Dutch Cup]] and extended his contract with the club the following month.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.elfvoetbal.nl/Overige/181292/Supertalent-Eriksen-tot-2014-bij-Ajax |title=Supertalent Eriksen tot 2014 bij Ajax |publisher=ELF Voetbal |date=10 April 2010 |accessdate=11 March 2018 |language=Dutch}}</ref> On 6 May, he played in the second match of the final of the [[2009–10 KNVB Cup|2009–10 Dutch Cup]] as Ajax beat [[Feyenoord]] 4–1, prevailing 6–1 on aggregate.<ref name=2010cup>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=291558&cc=5739 |title=Report: Feyenoord Rotterdam vs Ajax Amsterdam – Dutch Cup |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=6 May 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100508052455/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=291558&cc=5739 |archivedate=8 May 2010}}</ref> At the end of his first professional season with the club, Eriksen had played 21 competitive matches, scoring one goal, and had made his international debut for Denmark.<ref name=SW/><ref name=debut/> Eriksen's form throughout the campaign earned praise from manager [[Martin Jol]] who compared him to former youth products [[Wesley Sneijder]] and [[Rafael van der Vaart]] as well as Danish legend, [[Michael Laudrup]] for his reading of the game in the traditional [[Playmaker|"number 10" role]].<ref name=uefafaith>{{cite news |title=Eriksen puts faith in Ajax way by Berend Scholten |url=http://www.uefa.com/news/newsid=1459745.html#eriksen+puts+faith+ajax |publisher=UEFA |date=13 March 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.imscouting.com/global-news-article/Christian-Eriksen-The-new-Laudrup/7979/ |title=Christian Eriksen: The new Laudrup |publisher=IMScouting |date=27 May 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref>
====2010–2013: Breakthrough years====
Eriksen took the number eight jersey ahead of the following campaign and began the [[2010–11 Eredivisie|2010–11 season]] well, scoring his first Ajax league goal on 29 August 2010 in an away victory over [[De Graafschap]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.parool.nl/parool/nl/13/AJAX/article/detail/305683/2010/07/16/Ajax-maakt-rugnummers-bekend.dhtml |title=Ajax maakt rugnummers bekend |newspaper=Het Parool |date=19 July 2010 |accessdate=20 July 2010 |language=Dutch}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/29/netherlands/eredivisie/bv-de-graafschap/afc-ajax/941442/ |title=De Graafschap vs. Ajax |website=Soccerway |date=29 August 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011}}</ref> Over the course of the next few months, he scored his first home goal at the [[Amsterdam Arena]], in a 3–0 Cup victory over [[SC Veendam|BV Veendam]], and his first European goal, in a 3–0 [[UEFA Europa League]] win over [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/11/11/netherlands/knvb-beker/afc-ajax/veendam-1894/1038712/ |title=Ajax vs. Veendam |website=Soccerway |date=11 November 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2011/round=2000129/match=2003770/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Ruthless Ajax make Anderlecht pay the penalty |publisher=UEFA |date=17 February 2011 |accessdate=6 June 2011}}</ref> In between the milestone goals, Eriksen was also named [[Danish Football Player of the Year#Danish Football Association's award|Danish Talent of the Year]].<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web |url=http://www.dr.dk/Sporten/Fodbold/Landsholdet/2010/12/07/215702.htm |title=Christian Eriksen er Årets Talent 2010 |publisher=Danmarks Radio |first=Rikke |last=Darfelt |date=7 December 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011 |language=Danish}}</ref> His growing capabilities as the team's playmaker saw him become an undisputed starter in the side and he helped Ajax to their first [[2010–11 Eredivisie|Eredivisie title]] in seven years. At the end of the season he was named Ajax's [[List of AFC Ajax records and statistics#AFC Ajax prize winners|Talent of the Year]].<ref name=ajaxtalent>{{cite web |url=http://www.ajax.nl/Nieuws/Nieuwsarchief/Nieuws-artikel/Stekelenburg-Ajacied-van-het-Jaar.htm |title=Stekelenburg Ajacied van het Jaar, Christian Eriksen Talent van het Jaar |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=15 May 2011 |accessdate=6 June 2011 |language=Dutch}}</ref> His form throughout the campaign also earned him the [[Dutch Football Talent of the Year]] award which saw him become only the second Danish player to win the award since [[Jon Dahl Tomasson]] in 1996. [[Johan Cruyff]], whose panel selected Eriksen for the award, described Eriksen as a typical product of the Danish school and added to previous comparisons between him and [[Brian Laudrup|Brian]] and Michael Laudrup."<ref name=talentned>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/news/newsid=1634341.html#janssen+voted+eredivisies+best |title=Janssen named Netherlands' finest |publisher=UEFA |date=23 May 2011 |accessdate=6 June 2011 |first=Berend |last=Scholten}}</ref>
[[File:EriksenAjax2.jpg|thumb|Eriksen (right) playing for [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] against [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] in 2011.]]
On 18 October 2011, Eriksen scored his first goal in the [[UEFA Champions League]] when Ajax beat [[GNK Dinamo Zagreb|Dinamo Zagreb]] 2–0 in the [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/1642569#slide3 |title=Christian Eriksen to Liverpool: Tracking the Evolution of the Rumour |publisher=Bleacher Report |last=Greene |first=Laura |date=17 May 2013 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref> In the return fixture the following month, he provided assists to teammates [[Gregory van der Wiel]] and [[Siem de Jong]] as Ajax recorded a 4–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000263/match=2007632/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Stylish Ajax eliminate Dinamo |publisher=UEFA |date=2 November 2011}}</ref> Five days later he was named [[Danish Football Player of the Year]] in recognition of his role in helping Ajax to the league title the season before and in Denmark's successful [[UEFA Euro 2012]] qualification campaign.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=den/news/newsid=1714527.html |title=Eriksen and Pedersen honoured in Denmark |publisher=UEFA |first=Peter |last=Bruun |date=8 November 2011}}</ref> Eriksen continued to impress for Ajax and his strong contribution, both in terms of goal and assist returns, helped the club to a second consecutive league title.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2601/features/2012/05/11/3095096/goalcoms-eredivisie-team-of-the-season-vertonghen-eriksen |title=Goal.com's Eredivisie Team of the Season: Vertonghen, Eriksen & Dost make the cut |publisher=Goal |date=11 May 2012 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref>
Eriksen and Ajax repeated the feat in the [[2012–13 Eredivisie|2012–13 season]] following which he opted not to renew his contract with the club. With only one year remaining on his current contract, Eriksen was permitted to search for a new club and he agreed terms with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in England. Eriksen departed Ajax having made 162 appearances across all competitions and scored 32 goals. Along with his league success, he had also featured in three consecutive editions of the [[Johan Cruyff Shield]], which Ajax won once.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ajaxshowtime.com/bijzaken-en-geruchten/72894/de-statistieken-van-ruim-vier-jaar-eriksen.html |title=De statistieken van ruim vier jaar Eriksen |publisher=Ajax Showtime |date=30 August 2013}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== ====2013–2015: Premier League introduction and League Cup runner-up==== On 30 August 2013, [[Premier League]] club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] announced that they had completed the transfer of Eriksen from Ajax in a deal believed to be worth £11 million (€12.45 million).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/eriksen-arrives-300813/ |title=Eriksen Arrives |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=30 August 2013 |accessdate=30 August 2013}}</ref> Eriksen joined the club on the same day as [[Erik Lamela]], who joined from [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], and [[Vlad Chiricheș]], who joined from [[FC Steaua București|Steaua București]], and took the club's total spending for the [[List of English football transfers summer 2013|2013 summer transfer window]] to £109.5 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/30/tottenham-hotspur-erik-lamela-christian-eriksen |title=Tottenham's spend passing £110m with Erik Lamela and Christian Eriksen |newspaper=The Guardian |first=David |last=Hytner |date=30 August 2013 |accessdate=30 August 2013}}</ref> He made his league debut against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on 14 September 2013 and provided an assist for [[Gylfi Sigurðsson]] in a 2–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/23999467 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 2–0 Norwich City |date=14 September 2013 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Luke |last=Reddy}}</ref> After the match, Spurs manager [[André Villas-Boas]] commented, "It was a great debut for Christian, he is a pure number 10, a creative player and his individual quality made all the difference."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2013/09/14/uk-soccer-england-tottenham-idUKBRE98D09O20130914 |agency=Reuters |title=Eriksen proves life goes on for Spurs after Bale |first=Mike |last=Collett |date=14 September 2013}}</ref>
[[File:Christian Eriksen v Arsenal 1314.jpg|thumb|left|Eriksen playing for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2014]]
Five days later, Eriksen "clipped a wonderful dipping shot" over the goalkeeper to score his first Tottenham goal and complete a 3–0 win over [[Tromsø IL]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/300996/report |title=Europa League: Two Jermain Defoe goals secure Tottenham a 3–0 win over Tromso |publisher=Sky Sports |date=19 September 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2014}}</ref> He added to his Tottenham goal tally with a goal from a free kick in a 1–1 draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on Boxing Day 2013, and the second goal in Spurs' 1–2 away win against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 1 January 2014.<ref>{{cite news |first=Sam |last=Wallace |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-1-tottenham-2-match-report-united-unable-to-muster-recovery-after-emmanuel-adebayor-and-christian-eriksen-goals-9033107.html |title=Manchester United 1 Tottenham 2 match report: United unable to muster recovery after Emmanuel Adebayor and Christian Eriksen goals |newspaper=The Independent |date=2 January 2014 |accessdate=19 January 2014}}</ref> On 23 March, after goals from [[Jay Rodriguez]] and [[Adam Lallana]] had given [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] a 2–0 lead against Tottenham at [[White Hart Lane]], Eriksen scored twice to level the score and assisted Sigurðsson to score the winning goal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/26599215 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 3–2 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Aimee |last=Lewis |date=23 March 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014}}</ref> He continued his goalscoring form on 12 April 2014 when he scored a stoppage-time equaliser to help Tottenham come from 3–0 down to draw 3–3 at West Brom.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/26898645 |title=West Bromwich Albion 3–3 Tottenham Hotspur |date=12 April 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Andy |last=Cryer}}</ref> By the end of the season, he had scored ten goals and registered 13 assists across all competitions, won the [[Danish Football Player of the Year]] award and was named Tottenham's Player of the Season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://kwese.espn.com/football/club/tottenham-hotspur/367/blog/post/1983117/christian-eriksen-will-follow-the-same-path-as-luka-modric-and-gareth-bale-all-the-way-to-madrid?src=com |title=Eriksen is Tottenham's new galactico |website=ESPN |last=Fitch |first=Dan |date=12 August 2014 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref><ref name=POTS>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/christian-and-deleand39s-club-awards-double-130517/ |title=Christian and Dele's Club Awards Double |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=13 May 2017 |accessdate=16 November 2017}}</ref>
Ahead of the [[2014–15 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2014–15 campaign]], Tottenham appointed [[Mauricio Pochettino]] as new club manager after the unsuccessful period under Villas-Boas and interim-manager [[Tim Sherwood]]. Between November and December 2014, Eriksen scored late winners against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] and [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] which he credited to the Argentine manager for raising the team's fitness levels.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/dec/15/christian-eriksen-tottenham-late-winners-fitness |title=Christian Eriksen: Tottenham’s late winners down to raised fitness |newspaper=The Guardian |date=15 December 2014 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref> By the end of the calendar year, Eriksen had scored 12 goals from open play – more than any other player in England – and was soon after awarded his second consecutive Danish Footballer of the Year award.<ref name=DPY>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/christian-eriksen-wins-danish-player-of-the-year-for-third-year-running-2016-110116/ |title=Christian Makes History in Denmark |date=11 January 2016 |accessdate=11 December 2017 |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.}}</ref> On 28 January 2015, Eriksen scored twice in a 2–2 (3–2 aggregate) win over [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] to send Tottenham into the [[2015 Football League Cup Final|League Cup Final]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Sheffield United 2–2 Tottenham Hotspur (agg 2–3) |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/30910040 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Tom |last=Rostance |date=28 January 2015 |accessdate=28 January 2015}}</ref> His first goal, a 30-yard curling free kick, was later lauded by former professionals [[Michael Owen]] and [[Gary Neville]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://hereisthecity.com/en-gb/2015/01/28/eriksens-stunning-free-kick-onomah-and-ex-spurs-stars-react-on-t/ |title=Eriksen's stunning free-kick: Onomah and ex-Spurs stars react on Twitter |website=Here Is The City |first=Dan |last=Coombs |date=28 January 2015}}</ref> The final, played against London rivals [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], took place on 1 March and ended in a 2–0 defeat for Tottenham.<ref name=LC2015>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31572594 |title=Chelsea 2–0 Tottenham Hotspur |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 March 2015 |accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> Eriksen completed the 2014–15 campaign having featured in every Premier League game for [[Mauricio Pochettino]], starting all-but one match, and scored 12 goals across all competitions.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/eriksen-2014-15-goals-220615/ |title=Double Figures Delight – Christian on his 2014–15 goals |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=22 June 2015 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref>
On 9 June 2015, amid speculation that he would be joining [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], Eriksen confirmed to Danish media whilst on international duty that he would stay at Tottenham for the foreseeable future and was quoted as saying, "I feel right at home at Tottenham and I haven't thought about leaving yet."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/447144/Eriksen-to-stay-at-Tottenham |title=Tottenham star: I have absolutely NO intention of joining Manchester United |newspaper=Daily Star |first=Chisanga |last=Malata |date=9 June 2015}}</ref> He did in fact remain with the club and scored his first goals of the season in October, netting from two free-kicks in a 2–2 draw with Swansea.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2575222-why-eriksen-is-the-tottenham-player-who-must-produce-after-international-break |title=Why Eriksen Is the Tottenham Player Who Must Produce After International Break |website=Bleacher Report |last=Cooper |first=Thomas |date=6 October 2015 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref>
====2016–present: Premier League runner-up and PFA Team of the Year==== [[File:Eriksen20162(cropped).jpg|thumb|Eriksen striking a [[free-kick]] while playing for Tottenham in 2016]]
In January 2016, Eriksen was once again named Danish Footballer of the Year. In doing so he became the first ever player to win the award in three consecutive years.<ref name=DPY/> He ultimately scored 6 goals and registered 13 assists as Tottenham ended the league season in third place, thereby qualifying for the following season's [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] campaign.<ref name=BR>{{cite web |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2654675-christian-eriksen-tottenham-agree-on-new-contract-latest-details-and-reaction |title=Christian Eriksen, Tottenham Agree on New Contract: Latest Details and Reaction |website=Bleacher Report |last=Marsden |first=Rory |date=6 September 2017 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref>
The [[2016–17 Premier League|following season]], Eriksen signed a new long-term contract with Tottenham and starred once again for the club, scoring eight goals and assisting a further 15 as the club ended the league campaign as runners-up to champions [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/story/goal-50-english/ |title=Goal 50 – Journalists from across Goal's 37 editions voted in the 10th annual award for the world's 50 best footballers |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=16 November 2017}}</ref> Eriksen's tally of assists was bettered only by [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]'s [[Kevin De Bruyne]] who set up 18 goals for the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://talksport.com/football/premier-league-assists-201617-who-created-most-goals-season-170521240072?p=10 |title=Premier League assists 2016/17: Who created the most goals this season? |website=talkSPORT |date=21 May 2017 |accessdate=16 November 2017}}</ref> Eriksen also recorded the joint-most assists in the [[FA Cup]] and later won the Tottenham Player of the Season award, claiming the award for the second time after previously winning it in his debut season with the club.<ref name=FAC>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/english-fa-cup/40/statistics/assists?season=2016 |title=English FA Cup Statistics |publisher=ESPN FC |access-date=22 October 2017}}</ref><ref name=POTS/>
Eriksen broke the record for the most goals scored by a Danish player in the Premier League when he scored his 33rd goal in a 3–2 win over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 23 September 2017, surpassing the record previously held by [[Nicklas Bendtner]].<ref name=DP>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/tottenham-hotspur-christian-eriksen-record-breaking-premier-league-goal-nicklas-bendtner-arsenal-a7964126.html |title=Christian Eriksen happy to move Nicklas Bendtner to the side after his record-breaking goal against West Ham |website=The Independent |date=24 September 2017 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref> On 9 December, he made his 200th career appearance for Tottenham and marked the occasion by scoring in a 5–1 Premier League win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/first-team/match/report/spurs-v-stoke-city-match-report-091217/ |title=Spurs 5–1 Stoke – Report from Wembley |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=9 December 2017 |accessdate=10 December 2017}}</ref> The following month, he scored his 50th goal for the club when he netted after just 11 seconds in the 2–0 league win over Manchester United.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-za/news/eriksen-scores-after-11-seconds-for-spurs-against-man-utd/ypvppsdummy71vo012e2g8sfo |title=Eriksen scores after 11 seconds for Spurs against Man Utd |publisher=Goal.com |last=Floyd |first=Thomas |date=31 January 2018 |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> Eriksen's goal was the third-fastest goal ever scored in the Premier League era, bettered only by [[Alan Shearer]] and former Spurs captain [[Ledley King]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2018/jan/31/eriksen-scores-after-11-seconds-for-2nd-fastest-ep/ |title=Eriksen scores after 11 seconds for 3rd fastest EPL goal |newspaper=The Washington Times |date=31 January 2018 |accessdate=2 February 2018}}</ref> On 17 March 2018, Eriksen scored twice in an [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] fixture against Swansea to send Spurs to the semi-final for the second season running.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43353565 |title=Swansea City 0–3 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Michael |last=Pearlman |date=17 March 2018 |accessdate=17 March 2018}}</ref> On 1 April 2018, Ericksen scored a 25-yard goal in the away match against Chelsea, helping Tottenham to their first win in 28 years at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] in a match that finished 3–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11661/11313452/watch-christian-eriksens-rainbow-stunner-in-tottenhams-win-over-chelsea |title=WATCH: Christian Eriksen's 'rainbow' stunner in Tottenham's win over Chelsea |date=1 April 2018 |work=Sky Sports}}</ref> Later that month, in the reverse fixture against Stoke, Eriksen scored twice to earn Tottenham a 2–1 win. Following the match, however, teammate Harry Kane, who was challenging for the season's [[Premier League Golden Boot|Golden Boot]] award, claimed to have made the last touch on the ball for the second goal. Tottenham appealed to the Premier League panel who agreed that the ball touched Kane's shoulder and awarded him the goal.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43602488 |title=Stoke City 1–2 Tottenham |date=7 April 2018 |accessdate=11 April 2018 |first=Neil |last=Johnston}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43731208 |title=Premier League: Tottenham goal at Stoke awarded to Harry Kane |date=11 April 2018 |accessdate=11 April 2018}}</ref> On 14 April, Eriksen was named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]] for the first time, alongside teammates Kane and [[Jan Vertonghen]].<ref name=1718PFA>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43810017 |title=Manchester City players dominate PFA team of the year |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 April 2018 |accessdate=5 May 2018}}</ref>
In the [[2018–19 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2018–19 season]], Eriksen scored his first goal of the season in the [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] away match against [[Inter Milan]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/inter-vs-tottenham/401830 |title=Inter 2-1 Tottenham: Two late goals stun Spurs in Champions League opener|first= Gerard|last= Brand|date= 19 September 2018 |work= Sky Sports}}</ref> The match ended in a 2–1 loss for Tottenham, but in the home game against Inter, Eriksen scored again in the only goal of the game, giving Tottenham a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/tottenham-vs-inter-milan-result-champions-league-2018-goals-score-report-latest-a8657116.html |title=Tottenham vs Inter Milan: Christian Eriksen scores from the bench to give Spurs Champions League lifeline|first=Miguel |last=Delaney |date=28 November 2018 |work=The Independent }}</ref> He scored his first Premier League goal of the season on 15 December 2018 in the home match against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], a late goal that earned Tottenham a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/dec/15/tottenham-burnley-premier-league-match-report|title=Christian Eriksen’s late strike gives Tottenham win over Burnley|first=Nick |last=Miller |date=15 December 2018|work=The Guardian }}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth squads=== Eriksen was called up to the [[Denmark national under-17 football team]] in July 2007,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/news/newsShow.aspx?id=239942 |title=U/17-landsholdet til Internordisk Cup |publisher=Danish Football Association |date=9 July 2007 |accessdate=6 June 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> and impressed in his debut for the team on 31 July.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/news/newsShow.aspx?id=240235 |title=Tre point mod Færøerne |publisher=Danish Football Association |date=31 July 2007 |accessdate=6 June 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> In 2008, he scored nine goals in 16 games for the U-17s, and was named [[Danish Football Player of the Year#Young Players of the Year|Danish U-17 Talent of the Year]] by the [[Danish Football Association|Danish FA]].<ref name=dbu>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/news/newsShow.aspx?id=250290 |title=Lumb og Eriksen nyeste Arla Landsholdstalenter |publisher=Danish Football Association |date=5 December 2008 |accessdate=6 June 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> He was also one of four nominees for the 2008 Danish Talent of the Year award,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/news/newsShow.aspx?id=249275 |title=Danmarks fire største talenter |publisher=Danish Football Association |date=24 October 2008 |accessdate=6 June 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> which was won by [[Mathias Jørgensen]].<ref name=dbu/> He played 27 games for the under-17 team until February 2009. He played a total of eight games for the [[Denmark national under-18 football team|Denmark U-18]] and [[Denmark national under-19 football team|Denmark U-19]] teams during 2009. Eriksen was also called up for the Danish U-21 squad to the European championship in Denmark in 2011, the Danish team only participated in the group stage and Eriksen scored a goal against Belarus.
===Senior squad=== [[File:Eriksen Euro 2012.jpg|thumb|Eriksen playing for [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] at [[UEFA Euro 2012]]]]
Eriksen received his first senior Denmark call-up in February 2010,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bold.dk/nyt/Christian-Eriksen-Det-er-helt-vildt |title=Christian Eriksen: Det er helt vildt |website=Bold.dk |date=26 February 2010 |accessdate=13 April 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> making his debut in Denmark's friendly match against [[Austria national football team|Austria]] in March,<ref name=debut>{{cite web |url=http://sporten-dyn.tv2.dk/article.php/id-29005205.html?rss |title=Eriksen: Helt specielt med debut – TV 2 Sporten |publisher=Sporten-dyn.tv2.dk |date= |accessdate=13 April 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> to become Denmark's fourth youngest full international, being the youngest debutant since Michael Laudrup.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.haslund.info/danmark/aovs/ydeb.asp |title=A-landsholdspillere – Yngste debutant |publisher=www.haslund.info |date= |accessdate=18 May 2010 |language=Danish |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721203507/http://www.haslund.info/danmark/aovs/ydeb.asp |archivedate=21 July 2011}}</ref>
On 28 May 2010, Denmark coach [[Morten Olsen]] announced that Eriksen would be part of the final squad of 23 participating in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/news/newsid=1493391.html |title=Olsen names final Denmark squad |publisher=UEFA |date=28 May 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> He was the youngest player participating in the tournament.<ref name=youngest/><ref name=youngest2/> At the World Cup, Eriksen played two matches, against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] and [[Japan national football team|Japan]], but Denmark were unable to progress beyond the group stage.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/06/14/world/world-cup/netherlands/denmark/878795/ |title=Netherlands vs. Denmark |website=Soccerway |date=17 November 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/06/24/world/world-cup/denmark/japan/878799/ |title=Denmark vs. Japan |website=Soccerway |date=24 June 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011}}</ref>
On 9 February 2011, in a 2–1 friendly loss at home against [[England national football team|England]], Eriksen was named [[man of the match]], and was praised for his performance by a number of prominent footballing figures, including [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] star [[Frank Lampard]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://spn.dk/fodbold/landshold/article2335072.ece |title=Stjerne: Eriksen kan blive topspiller |newspaper=Jyllands-Posten Sport |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=10 February 2011 |language=Danish}}</ref> Man Utd star [[Rio Ferdinand]] (on Twitter),<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sporten.dk/fodbold/ferdinand-skamroser-eriksen-paa-twitter |title=Ferdinand skamroser Eriksen på Twitter |publisher=Sporten.dk |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=10 February 2011 |language=Danish}}</ref> manager Morten Olsen and several media experts in Denmark and England.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://spn.dk/fodbold/landshold/article2335260.ece |title=Engelske medier jubler over Eriksen |newspaper=Jyllands-Posten Sport |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=10 February 2011 |language=Danish |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20120720044254/http://jyllands-posten.dk/sport/fodbold/landshold/article2335260.ece |archivedate=20 July 2012}}</ref> On 4 June 2011, Eriksen scored his first national team goal to give Denmark a 2–0 lead over [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] in their [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group H|Euro 2012 qualifier]]. In doing so, he became the youngest Danish player ever to score a goal in European qualification, being nine days younger than Michael Laudrup when he scored his first goal in 1983.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1441/Ajax/article/detail/2441812/2011/06/06/Ajacied-Eriksen-speelt-Laudrup-uit-de-boeken.dhtml |title=Ajacied Eriksen speelt Laudrup uit de boeken |publisher=Ad.nl |date=16 May 2011 |accessdate=6 June 2011 |language=Dutch}}</ref>
====2018 FIFA World Cup qualification and tournament==== In the build-up to the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], Denmark were drawn in [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group E|UEFA Group E]] alongside the likes of [[Poland national football team|Poland]] and [[Romania national football team|Romania]]. Eriksen played a key-role during the nation's qualification campaign during which time he scored eight goals to earn Denmark a play-off against the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/great-dane-eriksen-is-danger-forireland-372f7gngj |title=Christian Eriksen is danger for Ireland |publisher=The Times |last=Hawkey |first=Ian |date=5 November 2017 |accessdate=15 November 2017}}</ref> The first leg of the play-off ended in a 0–0 home draw before Eriksen netted a [[hat-trick]] in [[Dublin]]'s [[Aviva Stadium]] in a 5–1 win to earn Denmark a spot at the World Cup.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41884909 |title=Republic of Ireland 1–5 Denmark (agg: 1–5) |last=Hafez |first=Shamoon |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 November 2017 |accessdate=14 November 2017}}</ref> Eriksen's treble took his tally to 11 goals for the qualification campaign, bettered only by Poland's [[Robert Lewandowski]] (16) and [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]]'s [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] (15) in Europe, and earned the praise of national team manager [[Åge Hareide]] who stated that Eriksen was one of the top 10 players in the world.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/17248/11127219/tottenhams-christian-eriksen-one-of-the-worlds-top-10-players-says-denmark-boss-age-hareide |title=Tottenham's Christian Eriksen one of the world's top 10 players, says Denmark boss Age Hareide |publisher=Sky Sports |date=15 November 2017 |accessdate=15 November 2017}}</ref>
In Denmark's opening match at the tournament, Eriksen assisted [[Yussuf Poulsen]] for the only goal in a 1–0 win over [[Peru national football team|Peru]] before scoring his first goal for the tournament in the 1–1 draw with [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] the following week.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/christian-eriksen-denmark-world-cup-2018-thomas-delaney-australia-a8411006.html |title=World Cup 2018: ‘Great things happen’ when you play alongside Christian Eriksen, Denmark’s shining star |publisher=The Independent |last=Miller |first=Nick |date=22 June 2018 |accessdate=22 June 2018}}</ref> Denmark ultimately progressed from their [[2018 FIFA World Cup Group C|group]] after which they were drawn with [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Round of 16|Round of 16]]. There they were defeated after a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]], with Eriksen being one of three players to have his spot-kick saved by Croatia goalkeeper [[Danijel Subašić]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jul/01/croatia-luka-modric-christian-eriksen-denmark-world-cup |title=Croatia’s Luka Modric fluffs big line but still prevails in duel with Eriksen |publisher=The Guardian |last=Pender |first=Kieran |date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref>
On 9 September 2018, Eriksen scored twice in a 2–0 win over [[Wales national football team|Wales]] to lead Denmark to victory in the nation's inaugural [[UEFA Nations League]] match.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/sep/09/denmark-wales-nations-league-match-report |title=Double from Denmark’s Christian Eriksen brings Wales down to earth |publisher=The Guardian |last=Candy |first=James |date=9 September 2018 |accessdate=11 September 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Eriksen lives with his girlfriend Sabrina Kvist Jensen in [[Hampstead]], London.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.seoghoer.dk/nyheder/det-hedder-soennike |title=Christian Eriksen deler sød hemmelighed: Det hedder sønnike |work=SE og HØR |date=31 December 2018}}</ref> Their first child, Alfred, was born on 4 June 2018.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bt.dk/fodbold/har-holdt-det-hemmeligt-i-maanedsvis-nu-afsloerer-christian-eriksen-soennens-navn |title=Har holdt det hemmeligt i månedsvis: Nu afslører Christian Eriksen sønnens navn|work=B.T. |date=31 December 2018 }}</ref>
